alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 13 at 10:56AM MDT until October 14 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT /4 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northerly winds 30 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27 possible. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma, Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. In Kansas, Cheyenne, Sherman, Wallace and Greeley Counties. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 3 PM MDT /4 PM CDT/ this afternoon. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust remains a possibility during the day across the area, especially near open or recently harvested fields.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
